utterances.utterance: Well, I think I understand the caution. OK? We have seen him. This is how he has talked in the past but I think that you could anticipate a question like that and say, let's get through Halloween. All right? Like we're going to do the Halloween and there's plenty of time to think about that.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Wear a mask.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think there's a love diminishing returns when it comes to his media appearances because there are so many of them that it's become basically like white noise. So, anybody that is hanging on his every word is already doing everything that the CDC says. And if the administration finds themselves in a position of needing to, you know, reach more people or get a different message out there in some ways, you need to add a new messenger to this because otherwise, people are not tuning in.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Do you agree with that, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wasn't listening. No, of course, I agree, I agree. But any question you asked him will be the same because hedging his bets, he's got nothing to lose and being safe because he is not a leader. He is a bureaucrat. He runs a -- he runs a department. So, he is never going to choose a path where there's an element of risk. That's what the leaders do, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We -- he's used -- you use him to factor in his expertise in a greater discussion so the leader comes in and he goes, what can you tell me. And he goes, that's fine. But he will never say, get back to work because that's a risk. We had this discussion in February last year, over a year or a year half ago that it always -- it's going to come down to an adult at a certain making the risk benefit equation. Somebody has to take the reins, not the whips, and because you are never going to risk down. You are never going to get the risk down to zero. And anybody trying is kind of people because the only way you can get the risk down to evil is by eroding freedoms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's the only -- if you want to down to zero you can put somebody in a room and lock them up. And that's kind of where we're headed at this point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Even Australia is going to have Christmas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. They have Christmas there, except it is upside down.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: It is. And they go to the beach. It is like our Fourth of July.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Christmas to them is always associated with beautiful --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And a kangaroo comes down the chimney.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And presence in his --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A lot of stuff in his pouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: In his pouch, yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: How do you feel about that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The pouch or Fauci?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Fauci.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tony lockdown. Listen, he is the top infectious disease doctor in the federal government, highest paid employee in the federal government goes on the top-rated Sunday morning news show and throws water on Christmas. Fall out comes the next day and he goes, no, no, no, I was taken out of context. He actually said that and then blames other people for misinterpreting what he said, and then wonders why people don't trust the science. We trust the science we just don't trust the scientists because the scientists like Fauci have flip-flopped on everything, masks, mandates, the WHO, lab leak. Last year he said the American people, we might not have to change what we're doing in our day-to-day lives that much. Well, how did that turn out? But the good thing is we won't have to deal with Anthony that much longer if things keep going the way we're going.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: What do you know?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cases and deaths are really, really going down. That summer surge is over. Hospitalizations are going way down. Florida's kicked it. The South has generally kicked it. It's moving up north a little bit. But if you have 77 percent of adults in this country vaccinated, plus boosters, plus antibodies, we're going to be pretty good. I think it's going to be something we can manage.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: And treatment.

utterances.speaker: HAROLD FORD JR. FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: The one thing -- yes, one thing that doctors have, all -- and scientists have all agree is the -- is the vaccine, people getting vaccinated. So, I'll give them some credit there. What are your thoughts on it?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: They've been horrible in their vaccine marketing because you know part of his alarmism is saying you have to get the vaccine. And even if you're vaccinated you could still get sickened by people who haven't gotten a vaccine which is an admission that the vaccine doesn't work. My problem is he's talking about Christmas and Hanukkah. We haven't gotten to Halloween and Thanksgiving. Kids --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or Columbus Day.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're getting rid of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Kids did not get to have a Halloween last year.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: And it's like, you know, you have little kids. You only have so many of them. My daughter last year had to bake a twilight cake with little gravestones for all the characters. It was very cute but she wanted to be out because the biggest pro tip, come to New York City for Halloween. Why? Because these giant buildings are filled with single people who don't have kids and they buy tons of candy. And at the end of the night, they'll dump their entire bag into your pillowcase. Boom. That's what they want this year and they're going to get it because they've been vaccinated. And Fauci doesn't -- he is not the voice of reason anymore and we need a second opinion.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Get vaccinated. Coming up, a former Facebook employee blowing the whistle on how big tech is hurting the country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's shaping up to be a bad week for Facebook. The company experiencing massive worldwide outages across its platforms as a Facebook whistleblower who gave the Wall Street Journal a trove, yes, a trove, of documents exposing how toxic the tech company is now going public. Troves.

utterances.speaker: FRANCES HAUGEN, FACEBOOK WHISTLEBLOWER
utterances.utterance: The thing I saw on Facebook over and over again was there were conflicts of interest between what was good for the public and what was good for Facebook. And Facebook over and over again chose to optimize for its own interests like making more money. The version of Facebook that exists today is tearing our societies apart and causing ethnic violence around the world. It chooses profit over safety. It is subsidizing. It is paying for its profits with our safety.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Facebook is trying to push back on the claim saying the site reflects the good, the bad, and ugly of humanity. That should be a movie. Now, Jesse, I will say that the outages were a distraction from the whistleblower and I stand by that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What were these outages? Did we lose Facebook?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Where have you been all day?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't -- I didn't even know about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Instagram and WhatsApp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what? I'm not hooked on the screens like some people, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I live my life. I read. I go to the library. Why is everyone laughing? Is it that clear that I don't go to the library?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's clear because no one does.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here's what I thought when I saw this. This woman comes out and says Facebook is tearing societies apart, and it's causing ethnic violence around the world. OK, last century, what did we have, the Russian Civil War, World War I, World War II, multiple ethnic cleansings all over -- almost in every continent. There was no Facebook then. We're going to now blame Facebook for my 2021 not as deadly as most of these in terms of conflict and civil war as the last century. And then we're getting torn apart here. I don't know, civil war, civil rights movement, anti-war protests. 2021, we sit on our couches and we complain. That's as tough as it gets now. I wouldn't all of a sudden say Facebook is the root of all evil. The real root of all evil is people like CBS News executives who then point the finger at Facebook, while it's them, the legacy media that's actually tearing this country apart. All Facebook is doing is letting people interact and talk about all these evil things that regular media is doing. Like, suppressing news, putting out fake news, you know, racial hoaxes, all that kind of stuff. Those are the real villains.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was a pretty impressive defense of Facebook. And we should let everybody know that you're on their board.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You've changed -- you've actually changed my -- the way I think about this in a way. Harold, I have a theory. TikTok is always a head start -- has a head start on humanity. So, we build these things, and then we start using it, and then we don't know the effect it has on us until many years past. And I think you can look at that at the highways and now the superhighways.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: So if you think about here and not and notwithstanding what Jesse said, they have internal documents that have been turned over, this whistleblower did, that showed that Facebook is aware of how some of their content is not altogether positive and healthy and that it is addictive particularly to young women. As a father of a 7-year-old who does not engage in so -- who does not mess with social medias on social media, and you think about some of the other things in this memo that said that they were aware that these young women were so conscious of how they looked and it might have impacted them negatively, but they didn't change any of their algorithms. Now, I don't disagree with you about whom all should be blame -- all the blame should be put on Facebook, but if you can't regulate yourself as a company like as big as this company is, one of the five biggest companies in the country, then Congress is going to do it for you. Zuckerberg and his team are going to have to come before the House in the Senate -- this is about Marsha Blackburn and a Democratic senator whose name is escaping me at the moment.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, I can picture him --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Who generally don't work together. They've come together saying --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Blumenthal.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Maybe Blumenthal. They've come together and said, you know what, we're going to call Facebook and Twitter and others in to tell us what other internal documents do you guys have but that shows that what you're doing is harmful to young women and children. Now, the reason this came out is because they're trying to develop another set of products for children.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: And people in the company said, wait a second, let's be clear about what's going on here before we go down this path and at least fix what we have --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm with you on the children's stuff, but the stuff she was blaming all the political violence on Facebook for --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: No, no you're right. And as I said, notwithstanding hat you said. I think this -- for me, this is a children's issue. And if they know what they're doing and they're not fixing it, they --Congress should regulate the daylights out of these guys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I agree with you on the children's stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kennedy, you have daughters.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I do, 12 and 16.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have 16 daughters?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I have 16 daughters. I have a harem. They're going to play basketball and track and soccer all at the same time. But they are on social media. And it scares the living crap out of me. It really does because there are -- you know, it's not just the social pressure which I think is enormous. And we have no comparison for it from when we were adolescents. You know, I look at my girls and I think, oh, their upbringing is so different from mine. And a large reason for that is social media. But Congress can do all they want. There's going to be more platforms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Kids are not on Facebook. You know, it's like Snapchat -- as a parent, Snapchat scares me a lot more than Facebook. What they see, what they have access to on TikTok -- and all these -- all these companies do is create algorithms --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: To make them more addictive.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That scares me.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: They really do.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: That's what the memo said.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Like, they figure out young brains and adolescent neuroscience and they appealed to that like cigarette companies did in the 60s, 70s, and 80s. So, yes, as parents we have to be vigilant. But I agree a company -- a private company has -- they're not selling fire extinguishers. You know, it's like they're selling narcissism and dopamine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: But guys, just the difference here is they know what it's doing. It's not like they're saying we're putting it out there and whatever is happening. People at the company is saying, you know what, here's what's happening with these products. They are addictive to these young women. And it's not healthy. And they say, oh, go ahead. It doesn't matter. And that's the problem for them I think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The last word to you, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that for those who hate Facebook, then today was a great day for them, right, because there was no Facebook.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. But now, I just see that the left is complaining that that means there's no WhatsApp and their constituents use WhatsApp, so now they're mad because there's no WhatsApp. And I'm really -- I'm really skeptical that the government is going to come in and make everything better. Like, when has that ever been true?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Amen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I also think that we start off by saying, they had a really bad press week. I mean, I would love -- Facebook is probably looking like when have we had a good press week? And where are the whistleblowers for Snapchat and TikTok and YouTube is another one, right? It's where people are seeing things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't TikTok owned by China, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, not exactly -- well, it's like China but the software -- yes. I mean, they would say no, but the thing is --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Xi Jinping is the CEO of TikTok. And he just pulls the levers and twists the knobs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. All right, "THE FASTEST" up next.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. It's so nice to have you. And it is time for "THE FASTEST." First up, big dumb Tom Brady making his highly anticipated return to New England --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What? That wasn't in the prompter.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: --who cares-- to face his old for the very first time. Tom coming out on top leading this -- leading two of this awkward embrace after the game with his former coach. Neither of them like the other. What did you make of that hug, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't think it was awkward at all. What do you want them to do, make out in the middle of like thousands of cameras?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would like that.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: A little bit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, no, it's fine. They're fine. Again, fake news.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Have we made too much of this? 30 million people tuned in for the game.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: I think we have a heck of a game. They -- Tom Brady, at the end of the game, said I want to thank Bill Belichick because he drafted me when no one else would draft me. Then apparently, Belichick went into the locker room, the Tampa Bay locker room and spent 30 -- almost 30 minutes with Brady just the two of them. So, I got to think that that was --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's nice.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: I agree with you. You can't -- that's what Belichick does with everybody. He would do that to his kids.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's gruff.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's not -- he's a direct guy.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Yes, he put his -- he put his kids on the coaching staff. That was another weird story that we're not going to get --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: And he's never hugged them.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Did you see the one wagging his tongue around?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Yes, I saw that.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that most -- when men hug, it's a little awkward. It looks awkward but I think the feeling was genuine between them.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I'm glad to hear about the locker room chat. That's very nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's got to be hard to work in a place where you still see the people you no longer work with. Isn't that weird?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, and then you have to hug them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you have to hug them. Yes, I mean, imagine if I left and went to like something like CNN but you -- I'd have to see you every weekend and it'd be really awkward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd still hug you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I'd hug you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh that's good. That's important.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Do you think your former and co-workers would swarm you like they did Brady last night? Like, Tom you never call or text. I'm going to try and touch you. We hate our new team.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: And now, up next, one restaurant taking a stand against unruly kids with bad behavior by banning patrons under the age of 18 from dining without their parents. So, Harold, this seems like the kind of thing where when you don't have kids, you think it's a great idea. But when you have kids, you want them to be able to go out with their friends. Where do you stand?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Look, I think that restaurant is right and I think they ought to get the names of the parents of those kids and ban those parents too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what this is -- yes, the parents are the ones.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's really about the parents.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, when you see all this stuff happening in restaurants, it's not young kids doing it. It's parents. It's adults.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's middle to high school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Drunks.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: And they do -- you know what they do at Chipotle which I do know?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: They're -- well, first of all, they're smoking e-cigarettes like right on the -- they don't pay for drinks and they go and they get like lemonade and coke and they don't pay for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, the money is with the alcohol. I'm with you on that. But I don't care about smoking e-cigarettes if that's next to me. They're throwing fries at employees.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's wrong.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't do that. That's too much, especially those big wedge-cut fries. Those things can hurt.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: You're talking about (INAUDIBLE)?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It's not the steakhouse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. You get like a curly fry to the eye.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, that could -- you'd be a pirate by next week.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know, it's like sometimes you go to a restaurant and let's just say that there's a bunch of kids at a table and then like the floor is a mess, like, everything is a mess, I always feel so bad.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: That's why toddlers and teenagers are the exact same. That is such a brilliant observation. Because when you take a toddler to a restaurant -- that's why dogs love tiny kids because there's food everywhere.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, free food.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It's the same with teenagers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Would you be OK with strangers hitting your kids? I've always wondered that because I don't have kids.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you come near Jesse Jr., I'll wallop you with this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying, like, could a waiter or if somebody just walk up and whack them on the side --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Knock it off. Whack them on the side of the head. That's why I'm not a parent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, that's my job.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It's the second time you've encouraged violence on the show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR
utterances.utterance: Book him.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Fentanyl -- felony, I mean.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Felony.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a felony.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You know what I mean? Maybe it lasted for two minutes and he was like, I got to get out of here. This is crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: "ONE MORE THING." Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, we haven't done this in a while. So, let's do it, finger pointing man.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Robots are great. Robots are great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, robots are great, but sometimes I don't think they're really robots. Check out this Boston Dynamics. Their robot dog was out at the University of Missouri game. Tigers is facing off the Volunteers, like you care. But everybody -- isn't this clever? It's cute, but it's not really a robot if someone is controlling it. And I've always felt that Boston Dynamics is selling us a bill of goods.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Is that robot twerking?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's actually twerking. It's twerking. And by the way, it is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, running man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's doing the running man.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Running robot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anyway, I don't know if this is actually a robot -- counts as a robot, but I do want one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Robots are great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They don't leave a lot of poop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just little batteries.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was the most sports Gutfeld watched all weekend right there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's absolutely right. I didn't even know there was sports.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Emma's grandparents Bob and Nancy Kenny, I just want to wish them a happy 65th wedding anniversary. That's right, 65 years of marriage. They were married September 29, 1956. They've got the whole family together to celebrate. They watched the Rutgers game. That's where they met, at Rutgers. And Rutgers got slaughtered. I think they lost by maybe five touchdowns so terrible game but great day. Nan and Pop, congratulations.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Great anniversary indeed. Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: We love you, guys. No matter where you are, I know you're hungry right about now. Every October 4th for the last 12 years, it is National Taco Day. And today is no different. Taco Dumbo supplied this massive cornucopia we have on the table, tacos of every stripe. So, if you are hankering, go ahead and go to -- Taco Bell is giving out free tacos today. Del Taco, the chain that started it all, go hit them up if you're in Southern California. And --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about Taco John?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: The Taco John is great. Wherever your favorite taqueria is, whether it's local or national --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is Taco Dumbo.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Yes, Taco Dumbo right around the corner.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which is in Dumbo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Succulent.
